newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks recover, post record gain.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks recover, post record gain.

text.p: Dhaka stocks bounced back to post a record single session gain of 6.82 percent on Tuesday, reversing a four-day decline, brokers said.

The Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) benchmark index rose 6.82 percent or 122.44 points to 1,916 on sharply lower turnover of 70.6 million taka. Of the 97 issues traded, 84 issues ended up, two closed down and one unchanged. The index rose 6.07 percent to 2005.24 was on October 6.
The share prices dipped after market regulator set the limit of price fuctuation of a share within 10 percent of previous day's rate effective on Saturday.

The market turned bearish also because of recent warning by the Secuties and Exchange Commission that the invetsors must avoid trading on 24 losing listed companies and shun transactions in the kerb market.
"The volume of trading was very low as sellers with high expectations did not budge from their positions," said broker Khurshid Alam.

"Buyers returned but sellers were in a rigid mood today. They (sellers) were expecting better price again after they lost in the past few days. Index rose but turnover dropped as a result," said another broker.
BD Lamp gained 668.75 taka to 7,364, Bangladesh Oxygen rose 34.73 to 484 and Shinepukur Holdings was up 15.08 at 168.
